intro: Brachycheila, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plants typically have small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink or purple. They are characterized by their compact growth habit and hairy stems. Brachycheila species are often used in rock gardens due to their ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
